bibl.title: Law and Justice in Ptolemaic Egypt.

Legal Documents of the Hellenistic World. Papers from a Seminar arranged by the Institute of Classical Studies, the Institute of Jewish Studies and the Warburg Institute, University of London, February to May 1986
bibl.author: MODRZEJEWSKI, (MÉLÈZE-) Joseph

bibl.note: 1. The survival of Egyptian law after the Macedonian conquest. - 2. The attitude of the Ptolemaic monarchy towards the legal traditions and the legal practice of the Egyptians and of the Greeks. - 3. The situation of the Jewish community and the fate of Jewish law in Ptolemaic Egypt. - Appendix [Texts and translation].
